metadata.Title: CVE-2023-5367 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: A out-of-bounds write flaw was found in the xorg-x11-server. This issue occurs due to an incorrect calculation of a buffer offset when copying data stored in the heap in the XIChangeDeviceProperty function in Xi/xiproperty.c and in RRChangeOutputProperty function in randr/rrproperty.c, allowing for possible escalation of privileges or denial of service.

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Jan-Niklas Sohn working with Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative

notes.Note: mdeslaur> xorg server is actually the xorg-server package the xorg package only contains docs xwayland package contains parts of xorg-server

criterions.comment: xorg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xorg-server: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xorg-server-hwe-18.04: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
